Base:Descriptions.Base:Description: the dark bank of a forest stream

A stream flowing to the east cuts through the otherwise thickly treed forest. The waters run fast and high, bloated by springtime melt. The sun pierces through the canopy of verdant new leaves to dance over the waters with glittering light.The surface of the steam glitters with the pale glow of the moon that pierces the canopy of new leaves. The water bubbles onward, slow and lazy in the heat of the summer season. Sunlight filters through the canopy of thick leaves to sparkle on the brook.The night cloaks the area in thick darkness, the heavy foliage above barely allowing any light to infuse the area. Fallen leaves of red, orange, yellow and brown cling to the banks of the babbling brook. The thinning canopy of autumnal leaves permit a golden rosy light to wash over the waters.Starlight and moonglow sneak through the thinning canopy of autumn leaves, glittering over the surface of the waters. Small bits of ice cling to the banks of the brook, occasionally breaking off to travel downstream. The sun floods through the bare branches of the canopy above but the light does little to free the air from the chill of winter.Starlight glitters through the leafless branches above, twinkling in reflection off the surface of the icy waters.

the down-sloping bank of a stream
The down-sloping bank of a clear stream.

Core:Properties.Core:Property: X[S] \{ A constant trickling of water can be heard. \| \The sun casts a warm light on the clear stream.\\The light of night casts a reflective glow on the clear stream.\ \| Something falls into the stream with a gentle plop. \| A cluster of leaves float down the stream. \| Somewhere out of sight, a toad croaks. \| \The night air is filled with the sound of crickets.\ \A \{fat\|plump\|short\|stubby\|long\|scrawny\|small\} fish swims downstream.\ \}

X[S] \{ A constant trickling of water can be heard. \| \The sun casts a warm light on the clear stream.\\The light of night casts a reflective glow on the clear stream.\ \| Something falls into the stream with a gentle plop. \| A cluster of leaves float down the stream. \| Somewhere out of sight, a toad croaks. \| \The night air is filled with the sound of crickets.\ \A \{fat\|plump\|short\|stubby\|long\|scrawny\|small\} fish swims downstream.\ \}
